intro: Mikania leiostachya, commonly known as the creeping Mikania, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and small, daisy-like flowers. The plant has heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, and it produces yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Mikania leiostachya is often found in disturbed areas, such as along roadsides and in open fields, where it can spread rapidly. Its ability to thrive in various soil types makes it a common weed in tropical and subtropical regions.
